Key Match Events: Croatia scored two goals in two minutes in the second half.
Klaus Gjasula scored an own goal and later equalized the match with a late goal.
Albania scored the fastest goal in Euros history in their opener against Italy and repeated it against Croatia.
Post-Match Reflections: Croatia's performance showed signs of aging legs and a lack of strength compared to previous tournaments.
Albania demonstrated great spirit and desire, securing a point against a strong opponent.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The match was marked by high-pressure moments and dramatic finishes.
Albania's resilience and fighting spirit were key factors in the game.
